qas.question: What region of italy was part of the Norman empire?
The only surviving mosaic from Norman held souther Italy is what?
The mosaics in churches of Ravello prove what?
What survives from the mosaics of Amalfi's Norman Cathedral?
What year were the mosaic pavements installed at the Otranto Cathedral?

context: <a0_0>Southern<a0_0/> Italy was also part of the Norman kingdom but great mosaics did not survive in this area except the fine mosaic <a1_0>pavement of the Otranto Cathedral<a1_0/> from <a4_0>1166<a4_0/>, with mosaics tied into a tree of life, mostly still preserved. The scenes depict biblical characters, warrior kings, medieval beasts, allegories of the months and working activity. <a3_0>Only fragments<a3_0/> survived from the original mosaic decoration of Amalfi's Norman Cathedral. The mosaic ambos in the churches of Ravello prove that <a2_0>mosaic art was widespread<a2_0/> in Southern Italy during the 11th–13th centuries.
